summary: Custom settings for the FXAA PPI that turn your Skyrim experience into a living comic book. I realize this isn\'t going to be for everyone but it is very definitely playable and extremely entertaining, especially to those of us who love to read comics.
descriptionHtml:
GAMEPLAY VIDEO: http://youtu.be/M9w62dTheAY

Awesome video by forum member Offtherails demonstrating the four different presests: http://youtu.be/rZ-F4adpc9M


I realize this isn\'t going to be for everyone but it is very surprisingly playable and extremely entertaining, especially to those of us who love to read comics. I have a fairly decent rig but I didn\'t notice a huge fps hit. If you can run FXAA PPI, then you can run these settings. 

IMPORTANT! YOU MUST INSTALL THE SPECIFIC VERSION OF FXAA PPI FOUND AT THE LINK BELOW. The main FXAA PPI mod found at the nexus will NOT work with my particular settings. 
This is based on the revision 37 version available here: https://www.assembla.com/spaces/fxaa-pp-inject/documents

- After downloading the rev_37 version above, find either the dx9 or dx10 folder(depending on which version of Skyrim you are using- most will be using the dx9 version) and drop all contents of that folder into your main Skyrim folder, then just drop the custom settings from the style folder of your choosing found in the graphic novel zip into the Skyrim main executable folder and overwrite. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
UPDATE: v3
Four different styles now available - check the images to see examples of the new settings

Graphic Novel
Anime
Living Paint
Sketchbook
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TO UNINSTALL: Simply delete the all files that came with the rev_37 version of the FXAA PPI including the custom settings file from the Skyrim Graphic Novel zip


Happy screenshot snapping!
author: joey4track
